name: Platinum Emperion
text: Your life total can't change. (You can't gain or lose life. You can't pay any amount of life except 0.)

editions.flavor: It ignores such insignificant forces as time, entropy, and death.

name: Plaxcaster Frogling
text:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{2}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Plaxmanta
text:
Flash
When Plaxmanta enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
When Plaxmanta enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {G} was spent to cast it.

name: Plea for Guidance
text: Search your library for up to two enchantment cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: On Theros, the dove is a symbol not of peace but of discovery. Quick wings herald the arrival of a revelation.

name: Plea for Power
text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for time or knowledge. If time gets more votes, take an extra turn after this one. If knowledge gets more votes or the vote is tied, draw three cards.

name: Pledge of Loyalty
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from the colors of permanents you control. This effect doesn't remove Pledge of Loyalty.

editions.flavor: Urza convinced many Dominarians not only to set aside their differences, but to embrace them.

name: Plover Knights
text: Flying, first strike

editions.flavor: The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.
The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.

name: Plow Through Reito
text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.

editions.flavor: The paths of the kami crisscrossed Kamigawa like scars left by a maddened surgeon.

name: Plow Under
text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.

editions.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land. To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

name: Plumes of Peace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Forecast — {W}{U}, Reveal Plumes of Peace from your hand: Tap target creature. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Plumeveil
text:
Flash
Defender, flying

editions.flavor:
"It was vast, a great sheet of soaring wings, and equally silent. It caught us unawares and blocked our view of the kithkin stronghold."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

"It was vast, a great sheet of soaring wings, and equally silent. It caught us unawares and blocked our view of the kithkin stronghold."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

"It was vast, a great sheet of soaring wings, and equally silent. It caught us unawares and blocked our view of the kithkin stronghold."
—Grensch, merrow cutthroat

name: Plummet
text: Destroy target creature with flying.

editions.flavor: "You are the grandest of all," said the archdruid to the trees. They became so proud of bark and branch that they suffered no creature to fly overhead or perch upon a bough.
"You are the grandest of all," said the archdruid to the trees. They became so proud of bark and branch that they suffered no creature to fly overhead or perch upon a bough.

—Dejara, Giltwood druid

The elf's blade carved deep into the Eldrazi drone's fleshy lattices. Without a sound, the drone lost equilibrium and tumbled from the sky.

name: Plunder
text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Suspend 4—{1}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

name: Plunge into Darkness
text:
Choose one —
• Sacrifice any number of creatures, then you gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature.
• Pay X life, then look at the top X cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and exile the rest.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Pointy Finger of Doom
text: {3}, {T}: Spin Pointy Finger of Doom in the middle of the table so that it rotates completely at least once, then destroy the closest permanent the finger points to.

editions.flavor:
"I would have made a ‘Spin-The-Bottle' joke if I thought anyone reading this had ever played the game."
—Bucky, flavor text writer

name: Poison Arrow
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

name: Poisonbelly Ogre
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Some claim it's a failed Simic experiment, others say a Golgari creation. Both guilds deny all responsibility, while secretly studying its strange virulence.

name: Poison the Well
text: Destroy target land. Poison the Well deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

editions.flavor: Wells that provide clean, unhaunted water are rare enough to be worth building an entire town around.

name: Polar Kraken
text:
Trample
Polar Kraken enters the battlefield tapped.
Cumulative upkeep—Sacrifice a land. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was big!"
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

"It was big. Really, really, big. No, bigger than that. It was big!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight

name: Polis Crusher
text:
Trample, protection from enchantments
{4}{R}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
Whenever Polis Crusher deals combat damage to a player, if Polis Crusher is monstrous, destroy target enchantment that player controls.

name: Political Trickery
text: Exchange control of target land you control and target land an opponent controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor:
"Politics is a game—move a stone here, move a stone there—except sometimes the stones bleed."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Pollenbright Wings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, create that many 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

name: Pollen Lullaby
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, creatures that player controls don't untap during the player's next untap step. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Pollen Remedy
text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose. If Pollen Remedy was kicked, prevent the next 6 damage this way instead.

name: Polluted Bonds
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, that player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: The mystic bond between spellcasters and the land is just as vulnerable to attack as the casters themselves.

name: Polluted Dead
text: When Polluted Dead dies, destroy target land.

editions.flavor: After the zombie attack, crops withered on the vine, and the thriving village became a ghost town almost overnight.

name: Polluted Delta
text: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Polluted Delta: Search your library for an Island or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Where dragons once prevailed, their bones now sink.

name: Polluted Mire
text:
Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana

name: Polukranos, World Eater
text:
{X}{X}{G}: Monstrosity X. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put X +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Polukranos, World Eater becomes monstrous, it deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures your opponents control. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to Polukranos.

name: Polymorph
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

editions.flavor: "Ahh! Opposable digits!"
"Ahh! Opposable digits!"

name: Polymorphist's Jest
text: Until end of turn, each creature target player controls loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.

editions.flavor:
"The flies were bothering me."
—Jalira, master polymorphist

name: Polymorphous Rush
text:
Strive — Polymorphous Rush costs {1}{U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose a creature on the battlefield. Any number of target creatures you control each become a copy of that creature until end of turn.

name: Ponder
text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
"We see the same sky as you, just through a different lens."

name: Pongify
text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller creates a 3/3 green Ape creature token.

editions.flavor: Some spellcrafting mistakes go on to become spells of their own.
Some spellcrafting mistakes go on to become spells of their own.

name: Pontiff of Blight
text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Other creatures you control have extort. (If a creature has multiple instances of extort, each triggers separately.)

name: Ponyback Brigade
text:
When Ponyback Brigade enters the battlefield or is turned face up, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
Morph {2}{R}{W}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Pooling Venom
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, its controller loses 2 life.
{3}{B}: Destroy enchanted land.

editions.flavor: The land can only hold so much poison before it begins to bite back.

name: Pools of Becoming
text:
At the beginning of your end step, put the cards in your hand on the bottom of your library in any order, then draw that many cards.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, reveal the top three cards of your planar deck. Each of the revealed cards' {CHAOS} abilities triggers. Then put the revealed cards on the bottom of your planar deck in any order.

name: Porcelain Legionnaire
text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
First strike

editions.flavor:
"My new design has lightweight plating specially cultivated from heretics' spare tissues."
—Izathel, priest of the Annex

name: Pore Over the Pages
text: Draw three cards, untap up to two lands, then discard a card.

editions.flavor: "‘I'm certain that the fate of Markov Manor is connected to these cryptoliths . . .' This Tamiyo was on to something."
"‘I'm certain that the fate of Markov Manor is connected to these cryptoliths . . .' This Tamiyo was on to something."

name: Porphyry Nodes
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Porphyry Nodes.

name: Portcullis
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if there are two or more other creatures on the battlefield, exile that creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control when Portcullis leaves the battlefield.

name: Portent
text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Portent of Betrayal
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

name: Port Inspector
text: Whenever Port Inspector becomes blocked, you may look at defending player's hand.

editions.flavor: "There may be a few minor additional fees, levies, duties, surtaxes, tariffs, imposts, tolls . . . ."

name: Port Town
text:
As Port Town enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Plains or Island card from your hand. If you don't, Port Town enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: A haunted fog known as the Nebelgast shrouds the cities along Nephalia's coast.

name: Possessed Aven
text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Aven gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target blue creature."

name: Possessed Barbarian
text:
First strike
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Barbarian gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target red creature."

name: Possessed Centaur
text:
Trample
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Centaur gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature."

name: Possessed Nomad
text:
Vigilance
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Possessed Nomad gets +1/+1, is black, and has "{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature."

name: Possessed Portal
text:
If a player would draw a card, that player skips that draw instead.
At the beginning of each end step, each player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she discards a card.

name: Possessed Skaab
text:
When Possessed Skaab enters the battlefield, return target instant, sorcery, or creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
If Possessed Skaab would die, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: A stitcher's attempt at a skaab with a soul.

name: Possibility Storm
text: Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand, that player exiles it, then exiles cards from the top of his or her library until he or she exiles a card that shares a card type with it. That player may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then he or she puts all cards exiled with Possibility Storm on the bottom of his or her library in a random order.

name: Postmortem Lunge
text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Return target creature card with converted mana cost X from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Poultice Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{2}, {T}: Regenerate target Sliver."

editions.flavor:
"Its broad claw suggests a chitinous shield, but in fact it conceals glands that secrete a remarkably swift healing agent."
—Rukarumel, field journal

name: Poultrygeist
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into any graveyard from play, you may roll a six-sided die. On a 1, sacrifice Poultrygeist. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on Poultrygeist.

editions.flavor: Farmer Brown never ate eggs again.

name: Pouncing Cheetah
text: Flash

editions.flavor: Rhonas's monument is home to a wider variety of creatures than anywhere else in the city of Naktamun—a feature most initiates fail to appreciate.

name: Pouncing Jaguar
text: Echo {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

editions.flavor: One pounce, she's hungry—you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs—you're in for a long day.
One pounce, she's hungry—you die quickly. Two, she's teaching her cubs—you're in for a long day.

name: Pouncing Kavu
text:
Kicker {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
First strike
If Pouncing Kavu was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with haste.

name: Pouncing Wurm
text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
If Pouncing Wurm was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with haste.

name: Powder Keg
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

name: Power Armor
text: Domain — {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor:
"Great peril demands formidable weaponry."
—Urza

"Great peril demands formidable weaponry."
—Urza

name: Power Artifact
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.

name: Power Conduit
text:
{T}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Choose one —
• Put a charge counter on target artifact.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: Never content, vedalken artificers continually tinker with their creations.

name: Power Leak
text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

name: Powerleech
text: Whenever an artifact an opponent controls becomes tapped or an opponent activates an artifact's ability without {T} in its activation cost, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The Forest of Argoth has developed a resistance to mechanical intrusion.

name: Power Matrix
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains flying, first strike, and trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: As he repaired the ship's planeswalking engine, Karn saw for the first time how he could catalyze the Weatherlight's evolution.

name: Power of Fire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.
The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.

name: Power Play
text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
You are the starting player. If multiple players would be the starting player, one of those players is chosen at random.

name: Power Sink
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

name: Powerstone Minefield
text: Whenever a creature attacks or blocks, Powerstone Minefield deals 2 damage to it.

editions.flavor:
"We have fought this far and lost too much. We will not turn back."
—Grizzlegom

name: Power Surge
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controlled at the beginning of this turn.

name: Power Taint
text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Pox
text: Each player loses a third of his or her life, then discards a third of the cards in his or her hand, then sacrifices a third of the creatures he or she controls, then sacrifices a third of the lands he or she controls. Round up each time.

name: Pradesh Gypsies
text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

name: Praetor's Counsel
text: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.

editions.flavor: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.
As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.

name: Praetor's Grasp
text: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it face down. Then that player shuffles his or her library. You may look at and play that card for as long as it remains exiled.

editions.flavor: Sheoldred weaves every thread of information into a noose to hang her enemies.

name: Prahv
text:
If you cast a spell this turn, you can't attack with creatures.
If you attacked with creatures this turn, you can't cast spells.
Whenever you roll CHAOS, you gain life equal to the number of cards in your hand.

name: Prahv, Spires of Order
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}{W}{U}, {T}: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

editions.flavor: Prahv, where much work is done to make sure nothing is accomplished.

name: Prairie Stream
text:
({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)
Prairie Stream enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or more basic lands.

editions.flavor: The continent of Ondu is a vast plateau crisscrossed by deep trenches and meandering rivers.
The continent of Ondu is a vast plateau crisscrossed by deep trenches and meandering rivers.
It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?

name: Prakhata Pillar-Bug
text: {B}: Prakhata Pillar-Bug gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: Not a mote of dust escapes the dutiful cleaners that keep the exclusive Prakhata Club immaculate.

name: Preacher
text:
You may choose not to untap Preacher during your untap step.
{T}: For as long as Preacher remains tapped, gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls.

name: Precinct Captain
text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.

editions.flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."
"In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."

name: Precise Strike
text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Hit where it hurts, and always hit first."

name: Precognition
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of target opponent's library. If you do, you may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

editions.flavor: A gleam like struggling sunlight penetrated Selenia's dark thoughts.

name: Precursor Golem
text:
When Precursor Golem enters the battlefield, create two 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature tokens.
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell that targets only a single Golem, that player copies that spell for each other Golem that spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those Golems.

name: Predator Dragon
text:
Flying, haste
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: Dragons make for spiteful gods.

name: Predator, Flagship
text:
{2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{5}, {T}: Destroy target creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle en-Vec

"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle en-Vec

"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Predator Ooze
text:
Indestructible
Whenever Predator Ooze attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Predator Ooze this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Predator Ooze.

name: Predator's Gambit
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
Enchanted creature has intimidate as long as its controller controls no other creatures. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

name: Predator's Howl
text:
Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Morbid — Create three 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens instead if a creature died this turn.

editions.flavor:
"And Muzzio says my arguments have no teeth."
—Selvala, ranger of the Lowlands

name: Predator's Rapport
text: Choose target creature you control. You gain life equal to that creature's power plus its toughness.

editions.flavor:
"Other guilds say the Gruul are savages, no better than the beasts we live with. I say we've found friends who won't stab us in the back."
—Domri Rade

name: Predator's Strike
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: If you hear it coming, you're not its prey.

name: Predatory Advantage
text: At the beginning of each opponent's end step, if that player didn't cast a creature spell this turn, create a 2/2 green Lizard creature token.

editions.flavor: Those who forget their past are doomed to be eaten by it.

name: Predatory Focus
text: You may have creatures you control assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.

editions.flavor: Instinct blood-tinted his world until he could see only one thing clearly: his prey.

name: Predatory Hunger
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.

editions.flavor: Hunger growls, never purrs.

name: Predatory Nightstalker
text: When Predatory Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent sacrifice a creature.

name: Predatory Rampage
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn. Each creature your opponents control blocks this turn if able.

editions.flavor:
"It is the fate of the weak to fall."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Predatory Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: No matter how much the slivers change, their collective might remains.
